description.zh-cn: 中国记者、编辑，曾担任上海《世界经济导报》的总编辑。蒙古族。因在1989年计划刊载纪念胡耀邦的文章而遭遇免职、报社停刊，并被长期软禁直至去世。
description.en: A Chinese journalist and editor of Mongol ethnicity, who served as the editor-in-chief of the Shanghai-based 'World Economic Herald'. He was dismissed from his post, his newspaper was shut down, and he was placed under long-term house arrest until his death for planning to publish an article commemorating Hu Yaobang in 1989.

description.zh-cn: 一份由钦本立创办并担任总编辑的上海报纸，以其自由派立场著称。因在1989年计划刊载纪念胡耀邦的文章而被停刊。
description.en: A Shanghai-based newspaper founded and edited by Qin Benli, known for its liberal stance. It was shut down in 1989 for planning to publish an article commemorating Hu Yaobang.

description.zh-cn: 浙江省湖州市下辖县，钦本立的出生地。
description.en: A county under the jurisdiction of Huzhou City, Zhejiang Province, and the birthplace of Qin Benli.

description.zh-cn: 浙江省的一所中学，钦本立曾在此就读，后因参与学潮被开除。
description.en: A high school in Zhejiang Province where Qin Benli studied before being expelled for participating in student activism.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代一所著名的法科大学，钦本立曾在此攻读法律，后因参与学生运动被开除学籍。
description.en: A renowned law university in modern China where Qin Benli studied law before being expelled for his involvement in student movements.

description.zh-cn: 上海的一家主要报纸。钦本立曾在此担任记者、编辑、党组书记和副总编辑等职务，1957年该报因响应“大鸣大放”遭毛泽东点名批评。
description.en: A major newspaper in Shanghai. Qin Benli held various positions here, including reporter, editor, Party Group Secretary, and Deputy Editor-in-Chief. In 1957, the newspaper was publicly criticized by Mao Zedong for its active participation in the 'Hundred Flowers Campaign'.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling political party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党上海市委员会的机关报，钦本立曾在1949年后在此任职。
description.en: The official newspaper of the Shanghai Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China, where Qin Benli worked after 1949.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的机关报，钦本立曾在1951年至1956年在此任职。
description.en: The official newspaper of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, where Qin Benli worked from 1951 to 1956.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。曾在1957年点名批评《文汇报》，导致时任该报领导的钦本立受到严厉处分。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China. He publicly criticized 'Wen Wei Po' in 1957, leading to severe punishment for Qin Benli, who was then part of the newspaper's leadership.

description.zh-cn: 1966年至1976年由毛泽东发动和领导的政治运动，期间钦本立遭到监禁和劳动改造等形式的迫害。
description.en: A political movement initiated and led by Mao Zedong from 1966 to 1976, during which Qin Benli was persecuted, including imprisonment and forced labor.

description.zh-cn: 上海市的社会科学研究机构。钦本立在文革后获得平反，并调入该院任职。
description.en: A social science research institution in Shanghai. Qin Benli was politically rehabilitated after the Cultural Revolution and transferred to work at this academy.

description.zh-cn: 中国经济学家，倡导创办了《世界经济导报》。
description.en: A Chinese economist who advocated for the founding of the 'World Economic Herald'.

description.zh-cn: 曾任中国共产党中央委员会总书记，被视为党内改革派的代表人物。《世界经济导报》因计划刊登纪念他的文章而引发政治事件并被停刊。
description.en: Former General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, regarded as a leading figure of the party's reformist wing. The 'World Economic Herald' was shut down after a political incident sparked by its plan to publish an article commemorating him.

description.zh-cn: 钦本立1918年出生于浙江长兴。
description.en: Qin Benli was born in Changxing, Zhejiang in 1918.

description.zh-cn: 1936年入读杭州高中，1939年因在校期间推动学潮而被开除。
description.en: Entered Hangzhou High School in 1936 and was expelled in 1939 for promoting student activism at the school.

description.zh-cn: 抗战时期考入朝阳大学攻读法律，后在大学三年级时因组织学生运动被学校开除学籍。
description.en: During the Second Sino-Japanese War, he enrolled in Chaoyang University to study law but was expelled in his third year for organizing student movements.

description.zh-cn: 因参加并组织学生运动，钦本立在大学三年级时被朝阳大学开除了学籍。
description.en: Due to his participation in and organization of student movements, Qin Benli was expelled from Chaoyang University in his third year.

position.zh-cn: 记者、编辑；党组书记、副总编辑
position.en: Reporter, Editor; Party Group Secretary, Deputy Editor-in-Chief

description.zh-cn: 钦本立曾两度在《文汇报》任职。抗战胜利后任记者、编辑；1956年9月返回上海任《文汇报》党组书记、副总编辑，直至1957年因反右运动被调离。
description.en: Qin Benli worked at 'Wen Wei Po' on two separate occasions. After the war, he was a reporter and editor; in September 1956, he returned to Shanghai to serve as the paper's Party Group Secretary and Deputy Editor-in-Chief until he was removed in 1957 during the Anti-Rightist Campaign.

description.zh-cn: 1949年加入中国共产党。
description.en: Joined the Communist Party of China in 1949.

position.en: Head of the Finance and Economics Group

description.zh-cn: 1949年5月上海战役后，任《解放日报》财经组组长。
description.en: After the Shanghai Campaign in May 1949, he served as the Head of the Finance and Economics Group at 'Jiefang Daily'.

position.zh-cn: 财经部、国际部工作人员
position.en: Staff of the Finance & Economics Department and International Department

description.zh-cn: 1951年赴北京《人民日报》财经部、国际部工作，直至1956年9月返回上海。
description.en: In 1951, he went to work in the Finance & Economics Department and International Department of the 'People's Daily' in Beijing, until he returned to Shanghai in September 1956.

description.zh-cn: 1957年，毛泽东点名批评响应大鸣大放号召的《文汇报》，并将其定性为右派报纸。
description.en: In 1957, Mao Zedong publicly criticized 'Wen Wei Po' for its response to the Hundred Flowers Campaign and labeled it a rightist newspaper.

description.zh-cn: 因《文汇报》事件，钦本立被调离该报，并受到留党察看两年、行政降三级的处分。
description.en: As a result of the 'Wen Wei Po' incident, Qin Benli was removed from the newspaper and punished with two years of party probation and a three-level administrative demotion.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命开始后，钦本立被关“牛棚”七个月，后又被下放到“五七”农场进行劳动改造。
description.en: After the Cultural Revolution began, Qin Benli was imprisoned in a 'cowshed' for seven months and later sent to a 'May Seventh' farm for labor reform.

position.zh-cn: 院党委委员、世界经济研究所党委书记、副所长、《社会科学》杂志主编
position.en: Member of the Academy's Party Committee, Party Secretary and Deputy Director of the World Economy Institute, Editor-in-Chief of 'Social Sciences' journal

description.zh-cn: 1978年12月文革结束后获得平反，调入上海社会科学院，先后担任多个职务。
description.en: After being politically rehabilitated at the end of the Cultural Revolution in December 1978, he was transferred to the Shanghai Academy of Social Sciences, where he held several positions.

description.zh-cn: 在钱俊瑞的倡导下，《世界经济导报》得以创办。
description.en: The 'World Economic Herald' was founded under the advocacy of Qian Junrui.

description.zh-cn: 1980年6月，钦本立主持创办了《世界经济导报》。
description.en: In June 1980, Qin Benli led the founding of the 'World Economic Herald'.

description.zh-cn: 自1980年创办起担任《世界经济导报》总编辑，直至1989年被免职。
description.en: He served as the Editor-in-Chief of the 'World Economic Herald' from its founding in 1980 until his dismissal in 1989.

description.zh-cn: 《世界经济导报》因计划刊载纪念胡耀邦的文章，此举意在维护和传播其改革派政治遗产，但最终导致报社被停刊。
description.en: The 'World Economic Herald' planned to publish an article commemorating Hu Yaobang, an act intended to uphold and disseminate his reformist political legacy, but which ultimately led to the newspaper's shutdown.

description.zh-cn: 因计划刊登纪念胡耀邦的文章，《世界经济导报》于1989年4月26日被中共上海市委勒令停刊。
description.en: Due to its plan to publish an article commemorating Hu Yaobang, the 'World Economic Herald' was ordered to cease publication by the CPC Shanghai Municipal Committee on April 26, 1989.

description.zh-cn: 因《世界经济导报》事件，钦本立于1989年4月26日被中共官方免去总编辑职务并置于软禁之下。临终前的1991年3月29日，又在病床前被上海市社科院党委宣布处以留党察看两年。
description.en: As a result of the 'World Economic Herald' incident, Qin Benli was dismissed from his post as editor-in-chief by CPC officials on April 26, 1989, and placed under house arrest. Shortly before his death, on March 29, 1991, the Party committee of the Shanghai Academy of Social Sciences announced at his bedside that he was being placed on two years of party probation.
